speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Enter KING CLAUDIUS and LAERTES

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Now must your conscience my acquaintance seal,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And you must put me in your heart for friend,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Sith you have heard, and with a knowing ear,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That he which hath your noble father slain

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Pursued my life.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: It well appears: but tell me

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Why you proceeded not against these feats,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: So crimeful and so capital in nature,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: As by your safety, wisdom, all things else,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: You mainly were stirr'd up.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O, for two special reasons;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Which may to you, perhaps, seem much unsinew'd,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: But yet to me they are strong. The queen his mother

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Lives almost by his looks; and for myself--

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: My virtue or my plague, be it either which--

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: She's so conjunctive to my life and soul,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That, as the star moves not but in his sphere,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I could not but by her. The other motive,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Why to a public count I might not go,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Is the great love the general gender bear him;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Who, dipping all his faults in their affection,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Would, like the spring that turneth wood to stone,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Convert his gyves to graces; so that my arrows,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Too slightly timber'd for so loud a wind,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Would have reverted to my bow again,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And not where I had aim'd them.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: And so have I a noble father lost;

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: A sister driven into desperate terms,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Whose worth, if praises may go back again,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Stood challenger on mount of all the age

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: For her perfections: but my revenge will come.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Break not your sleeps for that: you must not think

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That we are made of stuff so flat and dull

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That we can let our beard be shook with danger

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And think it pastime. You shortly shall hear more:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I loved your father, and we love ourself;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And that, I hope, will teach you to imagine--

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: How now! what news?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Letters, my lord, from Hamlet:

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: This to your majesty; this to the queen.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: From Hamlet! who brought them?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Sailors, my lord, they say; I saw them not:

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: They were given me by Claudio; he received them

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Of him that brought them.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Laertes, you shall hear them. Leave us.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exit Messenger

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Reads

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: 'High and mighty, You shall know I am set naked on

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: your kingdom. To-morrow shall I beg leave to see

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: your kingly eyes: when I shall, first asking your

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: pardon thereunto, recount the occasion of my sudden

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: and more strange return.                  'HAMLET.'

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: What should this mean? Are all the rest come back?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Or is it some abuse, and no such thing?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Know you the hand?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: 'Tis Hamlets character. 'Naked!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And in a postscript here, he says 'alone.'

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Can you advise me?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I'm lost in it, my lord. But let him come;

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: It warms the very sickness in my heart,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: That I shall live and tell him to his teeth,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: 'Thus didest thou.'

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: If it be so, Laertes--

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: As how should it be so? how otherwise?--

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Will you be ruled by me?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Ay, my lord;

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: So you will not o'errule me to a peace.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To thine own peace. If he be now return'd,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: As checking at his voyage, and that he means

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: No more to undertake it, I will work him

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To an exploit, now ripe in my device,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Under the which he shall not choose but fall:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And for his death no wind of blame shall breathe,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: But even his mother shall uncharge the practise

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And call it accident.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: My lord, I will be ruled;

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: The rather, if you could devise it so

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: That I might be the organ.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: It falls right.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: You have been talk'd of since your travel much,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And that in Hamlet's hearing, for a quality

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Wherein, they say, you shine: your sum of parts

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Did not together pluck such envy from him

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: As did that one, and that, in my regard,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Of the unworthiest siege.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: What part is that, my lord?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: A very riband in the cap of youth,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Yet needful too; for youth no less becomes

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The light and careless livery that it wears

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Than settled age his sables and his weeds,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Importing health and graveness. Two months since,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Here was a gentleman of Normandy:--

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I've seen myself, and served against, the French,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And they can well on horseback: but this gallant

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Had witchcraft in't; he grew unto his seat;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And to such wondrous doing brought his horse,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: As he had been incorpsed and demi-natured

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: With the brave beast: so far he topp'd my thought,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That I, in forgery of shapes and tricks,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Come short of what he did.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: A Norman was't?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: A Norman.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Upon my life, Lamond.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The very same.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I know him well: he is the brooch indeed

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: And gem of all the nation.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: He made confession of you,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And gave you such a masterly report

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: For art and exercise in your defence

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And for your rapier most especially,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That he cried out, 'twould be a sight indeed,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: If one could match you: the scrimers of their nation,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: He swore, had had neither motion, guard, nor eye,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: If you opposed them. Sir, this report of his

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Did Hamlet so envenom with his envy

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That he could nothing do but wish and beg

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Your sudden coming o'er, to play with him.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Now, out of this,--

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: What out of this, my lord?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Laertes, was your father dear to you?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Or are you like the painting of a sorrow,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: A face without a heart?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Why ask you this?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Not that I think you did not love your father;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: But that I know love is begun by time;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And that I see, in passages of proof,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Time qualifies the spark and fire of it.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: There lives within the very flame of love

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: A kind of wick or snuff that will abate it;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And nothing is at a like goodness still;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: For goodness, growing to a plurisy,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Dies in his own too much: that we would do

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: We should do when we would; for this 'would' changes

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And hath abatements and delays as many

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: As there are tongues, are hands, are accidents;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And then this 'should' is like a spendthrift sigh,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That hurts by easing. But, to the quick o' the ulcer:--

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Hamlet comes back: what would you undertake,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To show yourself your father's son in deed

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: More than in words?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: To cut his throat i' the church.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: No place, indeed, should murder sanctuarize;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Revenge should have no bounds. But, good Laertes,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Will you do this, keep close within your chamber.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Hamlet return'd shall know you are come home:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: We'll put on those shall praise your excellence

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And set a double varnish on the fame

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The Frenchman gave you, bring you in fine together

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And wager on your heads: he, being remiss,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Most generous and free from all contriving,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Will not peruse the foils; so that, with ease,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Or with a little shuffling, you may choose

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: A sword unbated, and in a pass of practise

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Requite him for your father.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I will do't:

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: And, for that purpose, I'll anoint my sword.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I bought an unction of a mountebank,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: So mortal that, but dip a knife in it,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Where it draws blood no cataplasm so rare,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Collected from all simples that have virtue

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Under the moon, can save the thing from death

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: That is but scratch'd withal: I'll touch my point

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: With this contagion, that, if I gall him slightly,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: It may be death.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Let's further think of this;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Weigh what convenience both of time and means

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: May fit us to our shape: if this should fail,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And that our drift look through our bad performance,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: 'Twere better not assay'd: therefore this project

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Should have a back or second, that might hold,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: If this should blast in proof. Soft! let me see:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: We'll make a solemn wager on your cunnings: I ha't.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: When in your motion you are hot and dry--

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: As make your bouts more violent to that end--

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And that he calls for drink, I'll have prepared him

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: A chalice for the nonce, whereon but sipping,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: If he by chance escape your venom'd stuck,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Our purpose may hold there.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter QUEEN GERTRUDE

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: How now, sweet queen!

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: One woe doth tread upon another's heel,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: So fast they follow; your sister's drown'd, Laertes.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Drown'd! O, where?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: There is a willow grows aslant a brook,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: That shows his hoar leaves in the glassy stream;

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: There with fantastic garlands did she come

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Of crow-flowers, nettles, daisies, and long purples

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: That liberal shepherds give a grosser name,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: But our cold maids do dead men's fingers call them:

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: There, on the pendent boughs her coronet weeds

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Clambering to hang, an envious sliver broke;

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: When down her weedy trophies and herself

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Fell in the weeping brook. Her clothes spread wide;

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: And, mermaid-like, awhile they bore her up:

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Which time she chanted snatches of old tunes;

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: As one incapable of her own distress,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Or like a creature native and indued

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Unto that element: but long it could not be

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Till that her garments, heavy with their drink,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Pull'd the poor wretch from her melodious lay

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: To muddy death.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Alas, then, she is drown'd?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Drown'd, drown'd.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Too much of water hast thou, poor Ophelia,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: And therefore I forbid my tears: but yet

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: It is our trick; nature her custom holds,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Let shame say what it will: when these are gone,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: The woman will be out. Adieu, my lord:

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I have a speech of fire, that fain would blaze,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: But that this folly douts it.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Let's follow, Gertrude:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: How much I had to do to calm his rage!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Now fear I this will give it start again;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Therefore let's follow.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
